snippet: The billionaire, Xu Ming, who was described as an associate of Bo Xilai, failed to appear as scheduled at the Bo’ao Forum for Asia, an annual gathering of leaders from business, government and academia.
abstract: Chinese authorities are investigating Chinese billionaire Xu Ming, who is described as an associate of Bo Xilai, high-ranking Communist Party official whose dismissal and confinement laid bare a split among the nation's leadership elite; it is unclear whether any inquiry will involve Bo.

byline.original: By MICHAEL WINES and SHARON LaFRANIERE
byline.contributor: David Barboza contributed reporting from Shanghai, Jonathan Ansfield from Beijing, and Jane Perlez from Bo’ao, China.

lead_paragraph: The billionaire, Xu Ming, who was described as an associate of Bo Xilai, failed to appear as scheduled at the Bo’ao Forum for Asia, an annual gathering of leaders from business, government and academia.

headline.seo: Xu Ming, Bo Xilai Associate, Under Investigation, Reports Say
headline.main: Billionaire Linked to Toppled Chinese Official Is Said to Be Under Investigation
headline.print_headline: Chinese Investigate Titan Linked to Toppled Official
